body_html: @odellus please note that this setup is not officially supported yet! First you'll need ROCm 1.8.2, which will be released very soon. Subsequently, you'll currently need external components (hcRNG, hcSPARSE, Thrust, cub-hip, exact versions and steps are in docker/caffe2/jenkins/common/install_rocm.sh - this is work in progress). Then you can follow the commands in .jenkins/pytorch/build.sh for building and installing. Again, please note that this is all work in progress! If you find issues and/or want to contribute patches, you can also head over to the ROCm fork of pytorch which we use as a staging area prior to upstreaming - in general we aim to have our fork and this upstream very closely in sync. Hope this helps.
